20. INT. GOBERNAR’S OFFICE - DAY
REPRISE:
[..] Doctor John Smith, his name is.
His real name is nothing of the sort.
Really? Well, if you’1ll excuse me I need to check on a few things.
Of course.
FX: GOBERNAR EXITS.
(CONT’D) So, Doctor, now you are here... the game can begin again.
THE MASTER LAUGHS.
21. INT. HEATHER’S LABORATORY —- DAY
(FADE IN:
FX: HEATHER IS SETTING UP EQUIPMENT - PLUGGING IN CABLES, COMPUTERS
AS THEY COME ONLINE, ETC.)
You don’t really need a lab assistant, do you, Dr Threadstone?
I need to finish setting up, and there should be some more equipment coming over from the mainland. But right at this moment — no.
Then I’1l1 leave you to it.
What are you going to do?
I think the gentleman who brought us over in the boat was trying to warn us about something.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 42
You’re sure he wasn’t just making conversation?
No. But if he does know something, then I think we should find out what it is.
I suppose so.
Besides, it’s a nice day for a good bracing walk.
Oh, and while you’re there, check my equipment’s on its way, would you?
Consider it done.
Thanks.
FX: THE DOCTOR LEAVES. HEATHER CONTINUES SETTING THINGS UP.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 43
22. EXT. ISLAND LANDING JETTY - DAY
(FADE IN: WIND AND THE SOUND OF THE SEA. THE DOCTOR WALKS BRISKLY UP.)
Ahoy there — er, Captain?
It’s you again. How can I help?
I’m curious. Earlier, you seemed to be warning my associate and I to be careful, up at the Institute. At least, that was the impression we went away with.
It’s only advice. Ignore it if you like.
What did you mean?
Be sure you know what you’re getting into. That’s all.
And do you know what we’re getting into?
Probably I shouldn’t have said nothing, but it seemed only fair to warn you.
Yes, but what about?
I’m not sure. But something’s not right.
You mean, something to do with the Dominus Institute?
Look, all I know is Dominus employ me to bring a lot of people over from the mainland in my boat. Like you and the lady.
Well there’s nothing odd about that, surely.
Nothing at all. But I bring far more people over here than I ever take back to the mainland. So, where do they go?
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 44
Where indeed? It is rather a small island.
It’s not like there’s many places they could end up. There’s the pub. A small shop. Then there’s Dominus.
You must have thought about this. What’s your theory, might I ask?
All I can think is that they use another boat for some journeys.
That’s certainly possible. Quite likely, in fact.
But like I said, it’s asmall island. Everyone knows everyone else’s business.
I can imagine.
So why don’t I know about no other boat? And why pay me to take some people back and not others?
Why indeed.
So, you be careful.
Oh I will, you can count on that.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 45
23. INT. HEATHER’S LABORATORY —- DAY
(FADE IN:
FX: HEATHER IS STILL SETTING UP.
A KNOCK AT THE DOOR.)
Come in.
FX: DAMIEN/THE MASTER ENTERS.
(CONT’D) Oh, Doctor Scott. It’s you.
Dr Threadstone. Sir Andrew told me you were joining us. I came to see how you’re settling in.
It’s Heather. Everything’s fine, thank you, er... Damien, wasn’t it?
(AWKWARD) Yes. Call me Damien.
(UNCOMFORTABLE) Damien. Well, I’m just waiting for some equipment to come over from the mainland. Nothing too important, but it’1l be good to get it all sorted.
I’m sure it will. Where is Doctor Smith?
My assistant?
Smith is his name, is it not?
He’s, er, he’s checking on the equipment.
Pity.
Pity? Why?
I wished to welcome him here, also. — Please, continue. I must return to my own researches.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 46
You have a lab here, too?
Yes, over in the east wing. (FORCED SINCERITY) It was nice to see
you again.
And you.
FX: THE MASTER EXITS.
You know, ‘Damien’, I got the impression that you were rather more interested in ‘Doctor Smith’ than you were in me. Why would that be, I wonder...?
FX: HEATHER FOLLOWS THE MASTER OUT.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 47
24. INT. DOMINUS CORRIDOR - CONTINUOUS
FX: THE MASTER’S DISTANT FOOTSTEPS. HEATHER CAUTIOUSLY FOLLOWS.
LOW, TO HERSELF That’s not the way to the east wing.
(FX: WE STAY WITH HEATHER AS SHE CAUTIOUSLY FOLLOWS.
A DOOR OPENS AND BANGS SHUT, CUTTING OFF THE SOUND OF THE MASTER’S FOOTSTEPS. )
LOW, TO HERSELF So what’s through there? Oh come on, Heather. It’s probably just the canteen. He’s getting a coffee or something.
FX: HEATHER OPENS THE DOOR.
LOW, TO HERSELF Or possibly not. Steps down? But we’re on the ground floor. Must be a basement... Well, we’ll soon find out.
FX: HEATHER STARTS DOWN THE STEPS.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 48
25. INT. DOMINUS BASEMENT - CONTINUOUS
(FADE IN:
ARRIVES AT THE BOTTOM OF THE STEPS.)
LOW, TO HERSELF Just a corridor... Could do with a bit more light. Now, which way?
FX: WE CAN HEAR THE MASTER’S FOOTSTEPS FADING INTO THE DISTANCE.
LOW, TO HERSELF Ah, that way.
(FX: HEATHER WALKS DOWN THE CORRIDOR.
THAT WE CAN NO LONGER HEAR THE MASTER’S FOOTSTEPS. )
LOW, TO HERSELF And round the corner, we find... Oh.
FX: HEATHER STOPS ABRUPTLY.
LOW, TO HERSELF But that can’t be right. It’s a dead end. It just stops. So where did he go?
FX: HEATHER SIGHS AND HEADS BACK THE WAY SHE CAME.
LOW, TO HERSELF Well, if I wasn’t suspicious before, I am now...
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 49
26. INT. HEATHER’S LABORATORY —- DAY
(FADE IN: WE JOIN HEATHER AND THE DOCTOR IN MID CONVERSATION: )
So then what did you do?
I just followed him down the corridor.
And where did he go?
That’s just it. He didn’t go anywhere. Or at least, the corridor didn’£.;
I’m not with you.
The corridor just stopped. It was a dead end.
And Damien?
Was nowhere to be seen.
Intriguing.
So, what do you think?
I think it’s unlikely he has a transmat or a teleport. I think it’s unlikely he can make himself invisible. And I think you should show me this dead end corridor in the basement.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 50
27. INT. DOMINUS BASEMENT - DAY
(FADE IN:
FX: THE DOCTOR AND HEATHER ARRIVE AT THE DEAD END OF THE CORRIDOR.
And there we are - you see?
You’re right, it doesn’t go anywhere.
Just a blank wall.
But that doesn’t make any sense. Unless...
FX: HE TAPS ON THE WALL. OVER THIS:
What are you doing?
I was just wondering if... Ah!
FX: THE DOCTOR'S LATEST TAP SOUNDS MORE HOLLOW.
(CONT’D) Somewhere here...
FX: A GRATING SOUND AS A SMALL PANEL SLIDES BACK.
What’s that?
An entry coder, concealed behind a hidden panel on the wall. Now, if I can just carefully reroute the - (opening mechanism)
(FX: HE BREAKS OFF AS THERE’S A POP AND A SHOWER OF SPARKS. THE DOCTOR
OUT, HIS HAND CAUGHT BY THE SPARKS. )
Are you all right?
Yes, yes - don’t fuss.
FX: A HIDDEN DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
There we are.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 51
A door. But, where does it go?
I rather think we should find out. Don’t you?
FX: THEY GO THROUGH.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 52
28. INT. ROOM OUTSIDE HIDDEN LABORATORY - CONTINUOUS
FX: THE DOCTOR AND HEATHER ENTER.
I think we’ll just close this up again.
FX: THE DOOR SLIDES SHUT.
There’s another room through there. It looks like a laboratory.
Let me see.
Careful - there’s someone out there.
Yes, several someones.
FAINT MOANING AND GROANING FROM THE NEXT ROOM
Look at them all. What’s wrong with them?
I don’t know. Pale skin, emaciated features. Not unlike the popular perception of those unfortunates often termed ‘zombies’.
They’re moving like they’re in a trance, that’s for sure. Except for the one in the middle there. Hooded, with his hands and legs chained.
(FX: A CLANKING OF CHAINS FROM THE OTHER ROOM AS THE FIGURE IS LED AWAY. )
A prisoner, perhaps? They appear to be leading him off somewhere.
There must be a back way out.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 53
Or another room.
(FX: THE CLANKING AND GRUNTING FADE AWAY AS THE BLANKS AND THEIR
LEAVE. )
Right, they’ve gone. So let’s see what we can find in this hidden laboratory.
Are you sure it’s safe, Doctor?
Oh I shouldn’t think so for a moment. Come on.
FX: THEY GO THROUGH TO THE LAB.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 54
29. INT. HIDDEN LABORATORY - CONTINUOUS
FX: THE DOCTOR AND HEATHER ENTER.
Look at all this stuff.
Stuff? There’s some highly advanced equipment here.
(FX: THE DOCTOR EXAMINES THE EQUIPMENT - A FEW BLEEPS ETC AS WELL AS THE SOUNDS OF HIM PULLING THINGS APART THEN PUTTING THEM BACK
(CONT’D) Alpha wave transcription, psycho-monitoring, and that looks like a waveform variation synthesizer. “Stuff”!
FX: HEATHER WALKS ACROSS TO ANOTHER AREA.
Doctor, I think you should see this.
FX: THE DOCTOR FOLLOWS HER ACROSS THE LAB.
What have you found now..? Oh. Another prisoner.
Unconscious. But why’s he strapped to the table? Were they going to operate on him, do you think?
Or monitor him, perhaps? He’s wired up to all this — “stuff”.
He’s got that same gaunt, pale look that those others had.
You know, this equipment is rather advanced. Too advanced for Earth in this time period, certainly.
We should help him.
What? — Oh yes. Let’s get the poor fellow unstrapped. You detach those wires and electrodes.
FX: THE DOCTOR UNSTRAPS THE MAN. HEATHER PULLS AWAY WIRES ETC.
Done it. Now what?
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 55
I think he’s waking up.
STIRS, MUTTERING GROGGILY
Must obey... obey... obey...
Perhaps he can tell us who did this and what’s going on.
I don’t think there can be much doubt that our friend Damien is involved somehow.
GROANS
(CONT’D) Easy now, easy does it.
HOWLS WITH RAGE AS HE LAUNCHES HIMSELF AT THE DOCTOR
Look out, Doctor!
Woah!
FX: THE DOCTOR IS KNOCKED BACKWARDS INTO EQUIPMENT.
He’s mad!
FX: THE MAN AND THE DOCTOR STRUGGLE
GRUNTING LIKE THE OTHER BLANKS, AS DOCTOR TRIES TO PUSH HIM AWAY
We're trying to help. We’re friends!
I don’t think he understands.
Get off me!
(FX: THE CLATTER OF METALLIC OBJECTS FALLING ON TO THE WORKBENCH AS HEATHER TIPS THEM OFF A METAL TRAY.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 56
THEN A METALLIC CLONK AS HEATHER HITS THE MAN OVER THE HEAD WITH THE TRAY.
CRIES OUT AND FALLS TO THE FLOOR — DEAD
Are you all right? What happened?
Oh, thank you for that, Heather. Lucky that tray of instruments was to hand. (CHECKS BODY — PERPLEXED) Oh.
Is he all right?
I’m afraid he’s dead.
Dead?! But I didn’t hit him that hard, surely?

No. No, you didn’t. There was nothing else you could have done. You saw how he was. The question now is, what happened to make him like that, and to weaken his body so that a minor injury could kill him?
And who was he?
From this equipment, I’d say he was something to do with Damien Scott’s memory project. Somehow this man’s memories - in fact his whole personality - were removed.
Leaving him like that. Like a vicious animal.
Terrified more likely. An empty shell working merely on instinct. A template... a ‘blank’.
Poor man.
Yes. Ah, well at least we know his name.
What’s that?
An identity badge. It was stuffed in his pocket.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 57
Who was he?
According to this.. Kenneth Albrecht.
One of the missing scientists.
And what's the betting that those other people we saw are also missing scientists?
With their minds blanked.
As you say. Except they were working to some purpose, not just instinctive. As if they’d been, I don’t know, programmed somehow.
Is that possible?
Anything’s possible. Here, give me a hand.
What are we doing?
I want to get Kenneth here back on the table, strapped down and wired
Up
FX: THEY HEAVE THE BODY UP ON TO THE TABLE.
Ooh, he’s heavier than he looks.
So we're making it look like whatever was happening to him just failed, and that’s what killed him?
That’s right. If you can just reconnect those wires there... No point in advertising that we’ve been here.
I guess not. And what then?
Then we follow those other ‘blanks’ and see where they went.
FX: THEY RE-ATTACH WIRES AND ELECTRODES. FADE OUT.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 58
30. INT. TUNNEL - CONTINUOUS
(FADE IN:
FX: A DAMP TUNNEL. DRIPPING WATER, ECHO.
THE DOCTOR AND HEATHER ARE MAKING THEIR WAY CAUTIOUSLY ALONG. )
Where do you think this tunnel leads?
I’m not sure. Good job there are lights though.
They hadn’t made any attempt to hide the entrance.
Well, it was already at the back of a hidden laboratory concealed behind an apparently solid wall in a disused basement.
(FX: WE CAN NOW JUST MAKE OUT THE DISTANT SOUND OF WAVES AS THEY APPROACH THE BEACH WHERE THE TUNNEL EMERGES. FADE IT UP AS THEY GET CLOSER. )
Good point... Can you hear that?
Yes. It sounds like the sea.
It is the sea. Look - there’s the end of the tunnel. It comes out on a beach.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 59
31. EXT. CAVES ON BEACH - CONTINUOUS
FX: THE DOCTOR AND HEATHER ENTER THE CAVE.
You were right. We’re in a cave. A cave at the bottom of the cliffs, I suspect.
I suppose we should have guessed. It’s a small island after all.
FX: THEY EMERGE ON TO THE BEACH.
Yes, you see I was right. Cliffs. Even so, I wonder where we are.
And where those ‘blank’ people went.
Yes. Let’s see if we can find a way up to the top.
That could be a path over there. It doesn’t look too steep.
Well spotted. With luck when we get to the top we’1ll see something we recognise...
FX: THEY SET OFF ACROSS THE BEACH.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 60
32. EXT. CLIFF TOP - CONTINUOUS
(FADE IN:
FX: IT’S WINDY ON THE CLIFF TOP. THE DOCTOR AND HEATHER HAVE TO SPEAK
LOUDLY TO BE HEARD.)
I can’t see the Institute, but I’d guess it’s that way.
I think you’re right.
What’s that, over there? It looks like a small castle.
A bit too modern for that, I think. A folly of some sort perhaps... Although...
Although? What is it, Doctor?
I’mnot sure. But there’s something. Something about that place that seems vaguely familiar.
You recognise it?
I certainly have the feeling I’ve seen it before, but I can’t quite place it.
Maybe you’ve seen pictures.
Maybe.
Was it on the Dominus website? There were some shots of the island.
Yes. Yes, maybe that was it.
So back to the Institute?
Unless you have a better suggestion?
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 61
The evening’s drawing in. I could do with something to eat. Though Gobernar said the canteen’s closed, didn’t he?
Yes, but he did mention a pub.
That’s a point. He said we can get food there.
And the other thing you can always get in a pub, is...
Drinks?
Information.
Ah. Right.
Though I’m sure we can get a drink as well. Now, if the Institute is that way, then from what our friendly boatman told me, the pub should be over there.
FX: THEY SET OFF TOWARDS THE PUB.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 62
33. INT. GOBERNAR’S OFFICE - EVENING
(FADE IN:
FX: GOBERNAR IS ON THE PHONE:
No, no, I quite understand. Thank you for letting me know... Yes, yes, please do. Good bye.
FX: HE HANGS UP.
The nursing home, I presume?
Yes.
Your sister continues to deteriorate.
SIGHS
I’m afraid so. Is there any chance, Damien — do you think?
Andrew, Andrew... There is every chance. You know how well the experiments are going, the results we have achieved.
Yes. It’s just that there’s so little time. I hadn’t expected her Alzheimer’s to advance so rapidly.
Then we must finish the experiments as quickly as we can. With your continued help and support, I can perfect the process in the next few days.
HOPEFUL
Really?
Would I lie? Your sister’s condition can be reversed. I’mclose now. So very close...
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 63
34. INT. PUB - EVENING
(FADE IN:
FX: SOME DRINKING AND CHATTING AS BEFORE.
THE DOCTOR AND HEATHER ARE EATING. HEATHER FINISHES HER MEAL AND
HER CUTLERY ON TO HER PLATE. )
You enjoyed that.
I did. It was rather good.
FX: THE DOCTOR LAYS DOWN HIS CUTLERY.
(CONT’D) You not finishing that?
I couldn’t manage another mouthful.
Pass it over, then.
The whole plate? Well, if you think you can manage —
FX: THEY SWAP PLATES.
Thank you. I’m famished.
FX: HEATHER TUCKS INTO THE FOOD.
Well, I’m glad to see it go to a good cause.
(MOUTH FULL) Hey, isn’t that the chap who brought us over in the boat?
I’m sorry? — Ah, you mean, “Isn’t that the fellow who brought us in the boat?”
(SWALLOWS) Yes. Over there, standing at the bar.
It is indeed.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 64
You never told me what you found out from him this afternoon.
Didn’t I?
No.
Probably because it didn’t amount to much. And what he did say has rather been superseded by events.
Oh?
He told me he brings more people over to the Dominus Institute than he ferries back again.
Ah.
Exactly.
And we know what happens to them now. Or at least, how they end up.
Exactly.
(FX: HEATHER FINISHES THE DOCTOR’S LEFT-OVERS AND PUTS DOWN HER CUTLERY. )
I enjoyed that.
I’m pleased to hear it. Now all it needs is another glass of ginger beer to wash it down with.
FX: THE DOCTOR GETS UP.
(CONT’D) Can I get you anything from the bar?
I’m fine thanks. Plenty left for now.
Well if you’re sure. I’1l ask them if they can clear away the plates at the same time.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 65
I expect they’1ll do that anyway.
You’re probably right. But I think while I’m there I’1l ask our friendly ferryman if he wants to join us.
Because my conversation isn’t stimulating enough for you?
Because he might know something about that castle.
You think it’s important?
I don’t know. But I think we should find out. Those blanked people were heading somewhere, and there’s not much else out that way.
FX: THE DOCTOR HEADS OFF TO THE BAR. HEATHER SIPS HER DRINK.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 66
35. INT. CELL - EVENING
(FADE IN:
FX: KEYS RATTLE IN LOOK. OLD CELL DOOR CREAKS OPEN.
HISS-HOWLS, ALERTED
(STEPPING IN) Hush yourself. I merely came to see if you were... comfortable.
HISSES IN ANGER
I’1ll take that as a ‘no’. Believe me — as dungeons go, this is positively palatial. I know.
DESPAIRING WHINE
My hearts bleed. Never fear, pitiful creature. It won’t be for much longer. Soon it will all be over. Soon. (CHUCKLES)
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 67
36. INT. PUB - LATER
(FADE IN: THE DOCTOR, HEATHER AND THE BOATMAN ARE DRINKING AND TALKING. )
So who owns it? The castle?
Government, they say. But it’s been empty for years.
What would the government want with a place like that?
I don’t know what they used it for. Before I came here, to be honest. Maybe it was something to do with the naval base.
Ah yes, we read that the Dominus Institute was an old military facility.
Not much left of the original base. Dominus tore down most of it and rebuilt from scratch. Not short of money, that lot.
Does anyone go there? To the castle?
No, it’s all fenced off. Not that they needed to bother.
Really - why’s that?
Locals won’t go up there anyway. They say it’s haunted.
Haunted? You mean by ghosts?
Guess so.
And has anyone ever seen these ghosts? Or is it just rumour and gossip?
Oh no, there are people who claim to have seen lights up there at night.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 68
That’s not terribly spooky.

Figures, too. Some lads were up that way a couple of months ago. They’d had a few too many drinks in my opinion, so I'd take their story with more than a pinch of salt. But they reckoned they saw the walking dead.
The walking dead?
Their words, not mine.
Did they describe these ‘walking dead’?
Yes, but only like you’d expect. Pale, thin figures lurching about as if in a trance. You know the sort of thing.
We certainly do.
FX: THE BOATMAN DRAINS HIS GLASS.
Well, thanks for the drink, Doctor.
No — thank you, for such an enlightening conversation.
Best be going. Got an early start in the morning, so I don’t want a late night. (LEAVING) I’1l see you again, I’m sure.
I’m sure you will.
FX: THE BOATMAN LEAVES THEM.
So, what do you think?
I think that unlike our loquacious friend, we may well be having a late night.
You want to go up to the castle and take a look, don’t you?
It would seem to be the logical next step, wouldn’t you agree?
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 69
I would. But if we’re going looking for the walking dead in a haunted castle in the middle of the night...
Yes?
I’1ll need another drink first.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 70
37. EXT. CASTLE PERIMETER FENCE —- NIGHT
(FADE IN:
FX: THE DOCTOR IS TEARING THE WIRE FENCE AWAY FROM ONE OF THE POSTS.
We’re lucky no one seems to maintain this fence... If I can just pull it free from the post... There, that’s done it.
Well done, Doctor. Don’t worry about the bottom bit, we can climb over that.
You’re sure?
Ask me in a minute.
FX: THEY CLIMB THROUGH THE GAP THE DOCTOR HAS MADE.
Yes, I’m sure.
We should probably fold it back into place. Makes it less obvious we’ve been here.
Here, let me help.
FX: THEY FOLD THE WIRE FENCE BACK AGAINST THE POST.
That should do.
So long as no one looks too closely.
I don’t think they get many visitors.
Probably out of season. Come the summer, this place will be overrun with tourists and ice cream vans. There’s probably a little gift shop inside.
Well let’s go and see, shall we?
FX: THEY HEAD OFF TOWARDS THE CASTLE. FADE OUT.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 71
38. EXT. CASTLE ENTRANCE - NIGHT
(FADE IN:
FX: THE DOCTOR AND HEATHER ARRIVE AT THE MAIN DOOR.
This looks like the way in.
It’1ll be locked.
FX: THE DOCTOR TRIES THE DOOR. IT IS LOCKED.
It’s locked.
Maybe we can find a window to climb through?
Oh ye of little faith.
FX: THE DOCTOR PRODUCES A METAL GADGET FROM HIS POCKET.
What on earth is that?
Pick-lock.
It’s ancient.
Ancient? It’s not ancient, it’s an antique. Belonged to Marie Antoinette, I’1ll have you know.
Of course it did.
FX: THE DOCTOR SETS TO WORK ON THE LOCK.
Since this is an old door, an old pick-lock should be just the thing...
FX: THE LOCK CLICKS OPEN.
There you go.
Well done, Doctor.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL)
FX: THE DOCTOR OPENS THE DOOR.
I said you should have more faith.
I never doubted you for a moment.
Page 72
FX: THEY ENTER THE CASTLE AND CLOSE THE DOOR BEHIND THEM.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 73
39. INT. CASTLE CORRIDOR - NIGHT
FX: AN ECHOEY STONE CORRIDOR.
There’s no light.
Hang on, I’11 use my phone. There’s a torch option on it somewhere, using the camera flash.
Good idea.
There doesn’t seem to be a Signal anywhere on this island, so I’m glad it’s useful for something... There we are.
That’s better. Not that there’s a lot to see... Although, this corridor...
What about it?
And that entrance...
Did I miss something?
Oh no, no, no. It’s me that’s missing something. I’msure I recognise this place.
Perhaps your mum brought you here for an ice cream when you were a kid?
I think that extremely unlikely. Let’s try this way.
FX: THEY MOVE OFF DOWN THE CORRIDOR, FADING AS THEY GO:
Or maybe you came here on a school trip?
Even less likely.
#212: VAMPIRE OF THE MIND by Justin Richards (FINAL) Page 74
40. INT. ANOTHER CASTLE CORRIDOR - NIGHT
(FADE IN:
FX: THE DOCTOR AND HEATHER WALKING DOWN THE CORRIDOR.
No sign of anyone. Nor that anyone’s been here, even.
No. It’s all rather disappointing.
Maybe we should head back to the Institute and think of something else.
Not just yet, if you don’t mind.
I’ve got nothing better to do. Except possibly sleep.
We’re still on the ground floor. Maybe there’s something interesting upstairs.
Not that we’ve seen any stairs.
Then that gives us something to look for.
FX: A MUFFLED THUMP, ACTUALLY FROM BELOW THEM.
What was that?
I’m not sure. Could be someone moving around.
Or it could be this place starting to fall down.
It came from below us.
Dungeons? That’s all we need.
